name: Access Runtime Application
summary: Learn about .ACCDR files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: If you want to run an ACCDB database in read-only mode, rename the file extension to ".accdr" and then open it. To restore the database to its original read-write format, rename the extension back to ".accdb."

description: A file with .accdr extension is a Runtime database file created with Microsoft Access database that is used to created relational databases. It is created as readonly database file that can be opened for viewing only and cannot be edited. Microsoft Access also allows to create other type of database files such as ACCDB, ACCDC, and ACCDT. ACCDR files in reality are ACCDB files, but with no provision to add, update or delete data from these files. ACCDR files can be opened with Microsoft Access and Office 365.

"Locked-down" database file created by the Microsoft Access relational database software; stores an .ACCDB database, except with the extension renamed to ".accdr;" allows the database to be opened and run in a read-only mode so that no changes are made to the database.
